question: 161. Which of the following are components of IAM? (Choose two.)
162. Which of the following are components of IAM? (Choose two.)
163. You are tasked with ensuring that a fleet of EC2 instances can retrieve data from S3 buckets. Which of the following might you need to create? (Choose two.)
164. Which types of access can you give a user via IAM? (Choose two.)
165. Which of the following are valid AWS and IAM policy types? (Choose two.)
166. In what language do you write IAM policies?
167. To which of the following can an IAM policy be attached? (Choose two.)
168. What does MFA stand for?
169. How does IAM provide scalability benefits to your application deployments? (Choose two.)
options: A. It allows assignment of permissions to users en masse via groups.
B. It handles allowing users access to hosted applications en masse.
D. It ensures that users do not accidentally delete objects from S3 stores.
C. It allows consistency in access from instances to managed AWS services across large numbers of instances.
answers: A. It allows assignment of permissions to users en masse via groups.
C. It allows consistency in access from instances to managed AWS services across large numbers of instances.

question: 170. Which of the following provide centralized user management across your AWS resources? (Choose two.)
171. What is power user access, as it relates to IAM roles?
options: A. The AWS name for the root user
C. A type of user that has full access to all AWS services and resources but not group or user management
D. A user that can access application deployment profiles
B. All IAM users are considered power users.
answers: C. A type of user that has full access to all AWS services and resources but not group or user management

question: 172. Which of the following can the root user not do?
options: D. The root user can do all of these.
B. Remove user access to the console.
answers: D. The root user can do all of these.

question: 173. Which of the following can a power user not do?
options: C. Stop a running EC2 instance created by another user.
D. The power user can do all of these.
B. Create a new SNS topic.

question: 174. Which of the following is a best practice for handling root user access keys?
options: A. Store them only in an instances-protected .aws/ directory.
D. Enable MFA Delete for when they are used in association with S3.
C. Only use them for API access but avoid console access.
B. Delete them and instead use different user IAM credentials.
answers: B. Delete them and instead use different user IAM credentials.

question: 175. Which of the following require root user credentials? (Choose two.)
options: C. Create a CloudFront key pair.
answers: C. Create a CloudFront key pair.

question: 176. Which of the following do not require root user credentials? (Choose two.)
options: C. Restoring revoked permissions for a user
A. Resizing an existing RDS instance
B. Deploying an application via a CloudFormation template
D. Changing support options for an AWS account
answers: A. Resizing an existing RDS instance
B. Deploying an application via a CloudFormation template

question: 177. How do you remove the AWS account root user’s access to your application EC2 instances?
options: D. You can’t remove access for an AWS account root user.
C. Remove any keys from the instance’s .ssh/ directory.
B. Switch the instance to only accept SSH logins.
A. Delete all the keys in the instance’s .aws/ directory.
answers: D. You can’t remove access for an AWS account root user.

question: 178. In a typical single-account AWS environment, which group of users should have root-level account access?
options: C. 2 to 3 developers or engineers responsible for account management
answers: C. 2 to 3 developers or engineers responsible for account management

question: 179. Which of the following is not a predefined AWS IAM policy?
options: D. These are all predefined policies in IAM.
answers: D. These are all predefined policies in IAM.

question: 180. You want to set your DevOps team up quickly in IAM. You have created users for each member of the team. What additional steps should you take? (Choose two.)
options: D. Attach the View-Only User policy to each user.
C. Attach the Developer Power User policy to each user.
A. Create sign-in URLs for the users.
B. Check the DevOps option for each user in the console.
answers: C. Attach the Developer Power User policy to each user.
A. Create sign-in URLs for the users.
